snippet: After a landslide electoral triumph by Bharatiya Janata Party, a Hindu nationalist party, some Muslims said they were worried their place in India could become even more tenuous.
abstract: Some Indian Muslims worry that their place in the country could become even more tenuous due to landslide electoral triumph by the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party; Narendra Modi, the party's leader, has had a fraught relationship with Muslims.

byline.contributor: Max Bearak contributed reporting from New Delhi, Vivek Nemana from Hyderabad, India, and Betwa Sharma from Varanasi, India.

lead_paragraph: After a landslide electoral triumph by Bharatiya Janata Party, a Hindu nationalist party, some Muslims said they were worried their place in India could become even more tenuous.

headline.main: For India’s Persecuted Muslim Minority, Caution Follows Hindu Party’s Victory
headline.print_headline: For Nation’s Persecuted Muslim Minority, Caution Follows Hindu Party’s Victory
